info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 6:32AM CDT until July 31 at 9:30AM CDT by NWS Omaha/Valley NE
info.description:
FFWOAX
The National Weather Service in Omaha/Valley has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Western Douglas County in east central Nebraska... Western Sarpy County in east central Nebraska... Eastern Saunders County in east central Nebraska... Northwestern Cass County in southeastern Nebraska...
* Until 930 AM CDT.
* At 632 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain has led to standing water on roadways and some stalled vehicles in western Sarpy County. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Law enforcement reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southwestern Omaha, Gretna, Elkhorn, Millard, Ashland, Valley, Springfield, Yutan, Louisville, Waterloo, Greenwood, Murdock, Leshara, Wehrspann Lake, Zorinsky Lake, Chalco, Flanagan Lake, South Bend, Two Rivers State Recreation Area and Camp Carol Joy Holling.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be prepared for poor visibility and standing water on roadways during your morning commute. Slow down and allow for extra travel time.

area.areaDesc: Cass, NE; Douglas, NE; Sarpy, NE; Saunders, NE
